For security reasons, *phpQuery* doesn't allow connections to hosts other than actual *$_SERVER['HTTP_HOST']* by default. Developer needs to grant rights to other hosts before making an [http://code.google.com/p/phpquery/wiki/Ajax AJAX] request.

There are 2 methods for allowing other hosts
 * phpQuery::ajaxAllowURL($url)
 * phpQuery::ajaxAllowHost($host)

{{{
// connect to google.com
phpQuery::ajaxAllowHost('google.com');
phpQuery::get('http://google.com/ig');
// or using same string
$url = 'http://google.com/ig';
phpQuery::ajaxAllowURL($url);
phpQuery::get($url);
}}}
